The US has no active nickel mines or nickel reserves. This report helps to update a prior Ni laterite mineral deposit model by Singer (1986) for use in quantitative assessments of mineral resources at national and global scales. completed Vladimir Berger U.S. Geological Survey 650-329-5731 345 Middlefield Road, Mail Stop 901 Menlo Park CA 94025 USA vladimir@usgs.gov pointOfContact asNeeded http://mrdata.usgs.gov/laterite/ofr-2011-1058.png Distribution of laterite deposits worldwide, (540 x 270 pixels) PNG mine sites mineral deposit areas theme Alexandria Digital Library Feature Type Thesaurus comma-delimited text DBF HTML table KML OGC WFS OGC WMS shapefile tab-delimited text theme General glossary for mineral resources spatial data Residuum theme Lithologic classification of geologic map units Cobalt Nickel, Laterite theme Mineral Resources Data System commodity types cobalt economic geology geospatial datasets metallic ores nickel unconsolidated deposits theme USGS Thesaurus Geology theme NGDA Portfolio Themes fAL = Albania fAS = Australia fBR = Brazil fBM = Burma fBY = Burundi fCM = Cameroon fCO = Colombia fIV = Cote D'Ivoire fCU = Cuba fDR = Dominican Republic f41019 = Douglas fET = Ethiopia fGR = Greece fGT = Guatemala fIN = India fID = Indonesia fKZ = Kazakhstan fMK = Macedonia fMA = Madagascar fNC = New Caledonia fPP = Papua New Guinea fRP = Philippines fRS = Russia fSR = Serbia fBP = Solomon Islands fTU = Turkey fVE = Venezuela place Common geographic areas thesaurus This report is preliminary and has not been reviewed for conformity with U.S. Geological Survey editorial standards or with the North American Stratigraphic Code.
